question: Which of the following causes Rabies?
option1: Virus and it affects the nervous system
option2: Virus and it affects the cardiovascular system
option3: Bacteria and it affects the nervous system
option4: Bacteria and it affects the cardiovascular system
answer: Virus and it affects the nervous system
explanation: Rabies infection is caused by the rabies virus. The virus is spread through the saliva of infected animals. Infected animals can spread the virus by biting another animal or a person. In rare cases, rabies can be spread when infected saliva gets into an open wound or the mucous membranes, such as the mouth or eyes. The rabies virus spreads by way of the nerve cells to the brain. Once in the brain, the virus multiplies rapidly. This activity causes severe inflammation of the brain and spinal cord after which the person deteriorates rapidly and dies.
